name: David Franklin
blurb:
Ira M. Friedman has been practicing family law since 1975.  In addition to representing clients in traditional family law matters, Ira and his firm Friedman & Friedman has a special emphasis in enforcement of orders and judgments in California. 

So long as the income or assets are located in California, Ira has successfully enforced judgments not only issued in California but also judgments requiring domestication from other states and countries.   Ira uses all of the tools found in the Code of Civil Procedure’s Enforcement of Judgment Act.
legal_orgs: Practice emphasizes Traditional Client Representation and Litigation

name: Ira Friedman
blurb: 100% Family Law
legal_orgs: Javascript is required to view this map.

name: Saul Gelbart
blurb:
Mr. Ginsberg is a founder of the family law firm of Harris • Ginsberg LLP in Los Angeles, California.  He represents parties in all aspects of family law, including property division, support, custody, paternity, prenuptial, post-nuptial, cohabitation agreements, and termination of domestic partnerships.  Mr. Ginsberg and his eleven-attorney firm specialize in the representation of high net worth individuals in high conflict situations, while also being “mediation friendly”. 

            Mr. Ginsberg is a Certified Family Law Specialist and a Fellow of the American Academy of Matrimonial Lawyers and the International Academy of Matrimonial Lawyers.  He has an AV rating by Martindale-Hubbell. He is a member of the Family Law sections of the American, California, Los Angeles County and Beverly Hills Bar Associations, and has been on the executive committees of both the California and Los Angeles County Bar Family Law sections. 

            Mr. Ginsberg has lectured to local, national and international organizations with regard to prenuptial and post-nuptial agreements, dissolution of marriage issues, and the future of family law, and is the author of several articles and a contributing editor to several Family Law publications.

            He is actively involved in the community in Board work for the benefit of low income individuals in family law and domestic violence matters.  He has been named as a Los Angeles Magazine “Super Lawyer” for 2004 through 2014 (including being named as one of the Top 100 Super Lawyers in Southern California in all areas of practice in 2010 and 2011), and as one of the “Best Lawyers in America” for 2007 through 2013.
legal_orgs: Practice emphasizes Traditional Client Representation and Litigation

name: Mel Goldsman
blurb:
Errol Jay Gordon was admitted to practice law in the State of California on January 15, 1970 following his graduation from Southwestern University School of Law in Los Angeles, California. He immediately commenced the practice of law at the Western Center on Law and Poverty through the University of California (USC). While at the Western Center, he worked on major litigation law reform projects. 

In late 1972, Mr. Gordon formed his own law firm, the Law Offices of Errol Jay Gordon, A Professional Corporation, which was located in the downtown Wilshire area of Los Angeles. The firm's name subsequently changed to Gordon | Gordon | Lawyers. However, since 1972, the firm's office location has remained the same.
legal_orgs: Traditional Client Representation and Litigation

name: Belinda Hanson
blurb: John E. Harding is an experienced divorce lawyer and mediator with expertise in divorce, post-divorce, parenting, paternity, property division, support, challenging and enforcing pre-nuptial agreements, and all other family law and domestic partnership matters. He has maintained an active family law practice in Northern California since 1989. In addition to being a family law litigator, he practices collaborative divorce and provides mediation services for couples with and without attorneys, case evaluation mediation, and parenting coordinator services. Offices in Pleasanton, California and Walnut Creek, California.

name: Camille Hemmer
blurb:
JAMES A. HENNENHOEFER, Certified Family Law Specialist, is a Fellow and past National President of the American Academy of Matrimonial Lawyers, a Diplomate of the American College of Family Trial Lawyers, a Fellow of the International Academy of Matrimonial Lawyer, a Certified Matrimonial Law Mediator and Arbitrator, an expert witness in Family Law matters, and also a Judge Pro Tempore in the San Diego County Superior Courts. 

Mr. Hennenhoefer has been recognized by Worth Magazine as one of the top 100 Trial Lawyers in the U.S.A. in all Legal Disciplines.  He was named by San Diego Magazine as one of the top 25 Attorneys in San Diego.  He has been continuously listed in Best Lawyers and Super Lawyers since the inception of each organization.

Mr. Hennenhoefer is an expert in ESI related issues.  He has lectured on all areas of Family Law, ESI, E-Discovery and Electronic Evidence throughout California and the United States.  He is a recent graduate of the National ESI Academy and is available for consultation regarding any aspect of ESI, from the ESI Hold Letter through Authentication and Admissibility of Electronic Evidence at trial.

name: Neal Hersh
blurb: Mr. Hodson offers traditional client representation in all facets of family law, in addition to arbitration, mediation, collaborative law, and services as private judge, special master and minors' counsel. He is Certified a Family Law Specialist by the State Bar of California, and a Northern California "Super Star" every year since 2005. Mr. Hodson chaired the State Bar Family Law Section and Executive Committee (FlexCom) 2009-2010 and remains an advisor to FlexCom. He is currently Legislative Director for the Association of Certified Family Law Specialists, and serves as a State Bar Mandatory Fee Arbitrator, as well as chairing the Solano County Bar Association Fee Arbitration Panel. He is a native of Providence, Rhode Island, educated at Rollins College (Winter Park, Florida) and The George Washington University (Washington, D.C.), and is a retired U.S. Air Force Judge Advocate with extensive trial experience.
legal_orgs: Traditional Client Representation and Litigation

name: Jennifer Jackson
blurb:
Over many decades and in a confidential setting, co-founding partner Daniel Jaffe has established himself as the sought-after attorney for high-profile clients with the most sensitive and complicated family law matters. His experience and success in and out of the courtroom have earned him the well-placed trust of many well known clients who seek his advice and skills when making critical, emotional and financial transitions in their lives. Dan combines a deep familiarity of the law with an innovative and discrete approach to achieve positive outcomes for his clients. 

Dan’s talents have been recognized by satisfied clients as well as by his peers in the legal community who frequently ask him to speak or write educational pieces on family law topics.  Likewise, the State Bar of California has certified him as a specialist in family law and he has been recognized for legal excellence in the field of family law by a variety of authorities, including the California State Bar Journal, Town and Country Magazine, and the Bar Register of Preeminent Lawyers.  In addition, the American College of Family Trial Lawyers has named him as a fellow, which is one of the industry’s most distinguished honors.
legal_orgs: Traditional Client Representation and Litigation
